body_html: My usual recommendation is to make sure that you do a host install of the protobuf version you've downloaded, to make sure that the headers, libraries, and protoc binary that's in /usr/* are compatible with the version we're compiling for Android. This may be overkill, and I'm looking at better ways of handling this (e.g. compiling a local copy of the host protobuf and using that local protoc), but it does simplify things a lot.

body: My usual recommendation is to make sure that you do a host install of the protobuf version you've downloaded, to make sure that the headers, libraries, and protoc binary that's in /usr/\* are compatible with the version we're compiling for Android. This may be overkill, and I'm looking at better ways of handling this (e.g. compiling a local copy of the host protobuf and using that local protoc), but it does simplify things a lot.
